revision.text: Possibly: Astronomia Carolina: a new theory of the Coelestial Motions. Composed according to the best Observations, and most Rational Grounds of Art; Yet far more Easie, Expedite and Perspicuous, than any before Extant. With Exact and most Easie Tables thereunto, and Precepts for the calculation of Eclipses, &c. By Thomas Streete. (London : Printed for R. Smith and S. Briscoe, and Sold by J. Woodward, in St. Christopher's Church-Yard, Threadneedle-Street, and J. Morphew, near Stationers-Hall, 1710.) http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2499219~S1
